'George Mason University' ('Mason)' Mason Spirit, Published by the Office of
University Development and Alumni Affairs in conjunction with the Office of
University Relations.

Kearney Rich, Colleen. "From the Archives: Whatâs in a Name?" Original: Mason
Spirit. Winter. 2006. Web: http://spirit.gmu.edu/2012/04/from-the-archives-whats-in-a-
name/ , frequently referred to as 'GMU', is a public university based in
unincorporated Fairfax County, Virginia, United States, south of and adjacent to
the city of Fairfax. "[http://www.fairfaxva.gov/Maps/CITY_MAP.pdf City
Map]." [[Fairfax, Virginia|City of Fairfax]]. Accessed October 20, 2008.
Additional campuses are located nearby in Arlington County, Prince William
County, and Loudoun County. The university's motto is Freedom and Learning while
its slogan or tagline is Where Innovation Is
Tradition. [http://logo.gmu.edu/ George Mason University's Visual Identity
Guide]. Logo.gmu.edu. Retrieved on 2011-03-11.

Named after American revolutionary, patriot, and founding father George Mason,
the university was founded as a branch of the University of Virginia in 1957 and
became an independent institution in 1972. Today, Mason is
recognized for its strong programs in economics, law, creative writing, computer
science, and business. [http://www.pw.org/content/201-
0_mfa_rankings_top_fifty_0 2010 MFA Rankings: The Top Fifty | Poets & Writers].
Pw.org. Retrieved on 2011-03-11. [http://grad-schools.usnews.rankingsandreviews.com/best-
graduate-schools/top-science-schools/computer-science-rankings/page+3
] http://som.gmu.edu/mba/rankings In recent years, George Mason
faculty have twice won the Nobel Prize in
Economics. [http://econfaculty.gmu.edu/wew/articles/02/nobel.html Another
Nobel Laureate] Walter E. Williams, GMU, Department of Economics, October 14,
2002 The university enrolls over 32,500 students, making it the largest
university by head count in the Commonwealth of Virginia. [http://www2.time-
sdispatch.com/rtd/news/local/education/article/GMUU15_20091014-221605/299431/ In
head count, George Mason edges VCU | Richmond Times-Dispatch].
.timesdispatch.com. Retrieved on 2011-03-11.
